channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: A U.S. doctor in Gaza wants President Biden to know 'we are not safe'
item.description: Dr. Adam Hamawy is a former U.S. Army combat surgeon currently in Gaza. He said he's treating primarily civilians, rather than combatants: "mostly children, many women, many elderly."
item.content:encoded: Dr. Adam Hamawy is a former U.S. Army combat surgeon currently in Gaza. He said he's treating primarily civilians, rather than combatants: "mostly children, many women, many elderly."
item.dc:creator: Clare Marie Schneider

item.title: Napkin securing Lionel Messi's first contract fetches nearly $1 million at auction
item.description: The handwritten restaurant napkin from the year 2000 was the starting point for an agreement between the then 13-year-old Messi and FC Barcelona.
item.content:encoded:
The handwritten restaurant napkin from the year 2000 was the starting point for an agreement between the then 13-year-old Messi and FC Barcelona.

(Image credit: Minas Panagiotakis)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: A member of Israel's war cabinet says he'll quit if there is no plan to replace Hamas
item.description: The ultimatum by war cabinet member Benny Gantz reflects discontent among Israel's leadership about Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's handling of the Gaza war and his far-right political partners.
item.content:encoded:
The ultimatum by war cabinet member Benny Gantz reflects discontent among Israel's leadership about Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's handling of the Gaza war and his far-right political partners.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: Boeing's troubled Starliner spacecraft launch is delayed again
item.description: A helium leak pushed back a planned launch to May 25. Boeing's program that would shuttle astronauts to and from the International Space Station has been plagued with problems.
item.content:encoded: A helium leak pushed back a planned launch to May 25. Boeing's program that would shuttle astronauts to and from the International Space Station has been plagued with problems.
item.dc:creator: John Helton

item.title: Pete McCloskey's life reminds us how politics long in the past live on in the present
item.description: McCloskey's story has both deep roots and burgeoning relevance. He died this month at 96 and had long been out of the limelight, but the issues he had been willing to champion are as salient as ever.
item.content:encoded:
McCloskey's story has both deep roots and burgeoning relevance. He died this month at 96 and had long been out of the limelight, but the issues he had been willing to champion are as salient as ever.

(Image credit: Jeff Chiu)
item.dc:creator: Ron Elving

item.title: Dabney Coleman, who starred in '9 to 5' and 'Tootsie', dies at 92
item.description: Dabney Coleman, the mustachioed character actor who specialized in smarmy villains like the chauvinist boss in "9 to 5" and the nasty TV director in "Tootsie," has died.
item.content:encoded:
Dabney Coleman, the mustachioed character actor who specialized in smarmy villains like the chauvinist boss in "9 to 5" and the nasty TV director in "Tootsie," has died.

(Image credit: Nick Ut)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Ohio reviewing race-based scholarships after Supreme Court affirmative action ruling
item.description: Higher education officials in Ohio are reviewing race-based scholarships after last year's Supreme Court ruling on affirmative action.
item.content:encoded:
Higher education officials in Ohio are reviewing race-based scholarships after last year's Supreme Court ruling on affirmative action.

(Image credit: Justin Merriman)
item.dc:creator: Sarah Donaldson

item.title: Other countries have better sunscreens. Here's why we can't get them in the U.S.
item.description: Skin cancer is the most common cancer in the U.S. and we need all the protection we can get. So why is it so hard to get newer, more effective ingredients approved here?
item.content:encoded:
Skin cancer is the most common cancer in the U.S. and we need all the protection we can get. So why is it so hard to get newer, more effective ingredients approved here?

(Image credit: Iana Kunitsa)
item.dc:creator: Michael Scaturro

item.title: These teens were missing too much school. Here's what it took to get them back
item.description: Since the pandemic, chronic absenteeism in the nation's K-12 schools has skyrocketed. These teens are working to get their attendance back on track.
item.content:encoded: Since the pandemic, chronic absenteeism in the nation's K-12 schools has skyrocketed. These teens are working to get their attendance back on track.
item.dc:creator: Leigh Paterson

item.title: In a debate over a school name, it's not just parents who are attached to the past
item.description: At the height of the racial reckoning, a school district in Virginia voted to rename two schools that had been previously named for Confederate generals. This month, that decision was reversed.
item.content:encoded: At the height of the racial reckoning, a school district in Virginia voted to rename two schools that had been previously named for Confederate generals. This month, that decision was reversed.
item.dc:creator: Leah Donnella
